H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H2672.def: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H5982.def: = a tall, vertical structure ◄ made of metal, stone, or wood ► and used as support for a building or for decoration

H2873.def: = causative action by which humans kill an animal by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe with a sharp-bladed instrument ► to prepare its meat for a meal; ≈ associated with aggression

H2874.def: = causative action by which humans kill animals by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe with a sharp-bladed instrument, ► to prepare its meat for a meal; ≈ associated with aggression

H4537.def: = action by which humans mix different ingredients into a single substance

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7979.def: literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H5291.def: = a young female, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H1610.def: = the physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a human being

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H7176.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall; ≈ poetic term

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6612.def: = person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2638.def: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H4537.def: = action by which humans mix different ingredients into a single substance

H6612.def: = person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H833.def: literally: to go forward on a road; hence: = to behave in a certain way

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3256.def: = action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H7036.def: = state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3971.def: = state in which humans or animals have a physical defect on their body

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3948.def: = causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H3687.def: = state of absence of wisdom, ◄ possible due to overconfidence, ► which manifests itself in immoral behavior

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H6615.def: = state of being easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of one's lack of wisdom and experience

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3678.def: = large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H7176.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall; ≈ poetic term

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3474.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to be without curve or bend and/or have an even or regular surface

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

14.gl: to make straight one's way > to walk straight ahead

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6612.def: = person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2638.def: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1589.def: = action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4985.def: = state in which food tastes well

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H5276.def: = state in which a person or object has qualities that inspire love and appreciation

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7496.def: = the spirits of those who have died and now reside in the {L:abode of the dead<SDBH:שְׁאֹול>}

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6012.def: literally: deep of tongue; hence: = state in which people speak a language that others find hard to understand

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
